bddtester.core.bdd.scenario

Class ScenarioOutline<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • bddtester.core.bdd.scenario.AbstractScenario
      • bddtester.core.bdd.scenario.ScenarioOutline<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of the Testdata.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Statusable

    public class ScenarioOutline<T>
extends AbstractScenario
    Represents a Scenario Outline in the BDD Hierarchy.
    It is the same as a Scenario except that it has test data. This means, that the scenario gets executed once with each test data.
    Author:
    ckeiner

      • test

        public void test()
        Executes the scenario outline.
        Exceptions and errors get caught and the scenario is executed with the rest of the test data. In the end, the exceptions and errors are re-thrown as ScenarioException and ScenarioError respectively.
        Should both, an exception and an error, occur, a FeatureException is thrown.
        Specified by:
        test in class AbstractScenario

      • skipScenario

        public void skipScenario()
        Description copied from class: AbstractScenario
        Skips the scenario and reports it as such.
        Specified by:
        skipScenario in class AbstractScenario

      • finishScenario

        public void finishScenario(java.util.List<ScenarioException> scenarioExceptions,
                           java.util.List<ScenarioError> scenarioErrors)
        Throws ScenarioException or ScenarioError if the respective parameter isn't emtpy.
        If both, an exception and error, occur, a ScenarioException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        scenarioExceptions - The list of scenarioExceptions that happened in the scenario.
        scenarioErrors - The list of scenarioErrors that happened in the scenario.
